jclustering

Class Cluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • jclustering.Cluster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Cluster>

    public class Cluster
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Cluster>
    Implements a cluster class. A cluster is defined by a centroid (a double [] array) and by the mean TAC of the voxels assigned to this cluster. Every other elements from this class serve as helpers for latter calculations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cluster

        public Cluster()
        Public constructor. Does nothing by default, just initializes the internal containers.

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(double[] centroid)
        Public constructor with a pre-defined centroid.

        centroid - Centroid vector.

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(double[] centroid,
       boolean modify_centroid)
        Public constructor with a pre-defined centroid an a boolean option for centroid modification. If modify_centroid is set to true, then the centroid for this cluster will be modified with each new TAC that is added to this object.
        Parameters:
        centroid - Centroid vector.
        modify_centroid - Should the centroid be modified with each new TAC.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        The number of pixels inside this cluster.

      • add

        public void add(double[] data)
        Adds given data to cluster. It can work in two different ways:
        • It can modify this cluster's centroid as new voxels are added.
        • The centroid can remain static and the news voxels are added independently, forming a new TAC.
        The second way is the standard way of creating a new cluster, where the centroid serves as the reference for the distances. In any case, as there are some approaches in which the centroid is built along the way, the parameter modify_centroid is offered in the Cluster constructor. This method uses the default behavior used at creation time.
        Parameters:
        data - Dynamic data to be added

      • getPeakStats

        public org.apache.commons.math3.stat.descriptive.SummaryStatistics getPeakStats()
        Returns:
        A SummaryStatistics object with the peak amplitudes data.

      • getPeakMean

        public double getPeakMean()
        Returns:

      • getPeakStdev

        public double getPeakStdev()
        Returns:
        Standard deviation for peak values for all TACs in cluster.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Cluster that)
        Implements Comparable interface. Use size and mean peak as elements to compute each score.
        Specified by:
